page.title: 02MOUNT PLEASANT SCHOOL
page.content: { Mount Pleasant Primary School}is in the town of{Thurso}on Scotland's far north coast.It is situated in the County of{Caithness. The school was opened in 1966 to cope with the large increase in population brought about by the placing of the{Dounreay Atomic Reactor in the area. Mount Pleasant is housed in a modern well constructed building. It is fortunate that at the time of building there were no constraints on spending and so materials and facilities were provided that would not have been forthcoming today. The school was built to house two streams of pupils and placed in ample playing fields. Now with falling roll it houses a single stream of pupils and a nursery unit giving a total child population of 240.
